snippet: A wide-ranging look at efforts to free the world’s institutional secrets — from the cryptography revolution of the 1970s to WikiLeaks.
abstract: Evgeny Morozov reviews book This Machine Kills Secrets: How WikiLeakers, Cypherpunks and Hacktivists Aim to Free the World's Information by Andy Greenberg.
lead_paragraph: A wide-ranging look at efforts to free the world’s institutional secrets — from the cryptography revolution of the 1970s to WikiLeaks.

headline.seo: ‘This Machine Kills Secrets,’ by Andy Greenberg
headline.main: And the Firewalls Came Tumbling Down
headline.print_headline: And the Firewalls Came Tumbling Down
